text.front:
A Neural Net for Determining Structural
Similarity of Recursive Programs
Kristina Sch adler, Ute Schmid, Hendrik L ubben, Bernd
Machenschalk
Subject group \Methods of Arti cial Intelligence"
Institute for Applied Computer Science, Technische Universit at
Berlin
email: schaedle,schmid,compuman,herold@cs.tu-berlin.de
Abstract.
In this work it will be shown, how the comparison of recur-
sive program schemata (RPS) can be reduced to an only slightly modi ed
type of the search for maximal isomorphic subgraphs by interpreting the
RPS as directed, cyclic, marked graphs. The quality of the mapping of
two RPS can be used as a quantitative measure for similarity of RPS
among each other. The simultaneously calculated graph morphism can
serve as a basis for the detection of analogies between the RPS. A special
neural net, developed for the solution of general graph-matching prob-
lems, realizes the search for a sensible and as comprising as possible
mapping between two RPS. It is shown, which special properties of RPS
have to be accounted for in the modeling and how these can be incorpo-
rated into the algorithms when using a special neural approach for the
solution.
